title: The Total Art of Stalinism: Avant-Garde, Aesthetic Dictatorship,
description:
From the ruins of communism, Boris Groys emerges to provoke our interest in the aesthetic goals pursued with such catastrophic consequences by its founders. Interpreting totalitarian art and literature in the context of cultural history, this brilliant essay likens totalitarian aims to the modernistsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ goal of producing world-transformative art. In this new edition, Groys revisits the debate that the book has stimulated since its first publication.
